meta.title: Complete Kids Coding Masterclass - Block Programming to Professional Skills
meta.description: The most comprehensive 2-year coding program for kids using visual block programming. From zero experience to creating games, apps, AI projects, and professional digital skills. Master Scratch, AI tools, design with Canva, Microsoft Office, video editing, and transition to real programming.
meta.certification: Digital Creator & Coder Certification upon completion

program_overview.title: Complete Kids Coding Masterclass with Blocks
program_overview.tagline: From First Click to Digital Creator - A Journey of Innovation and Fun
program_overview.description:
This revolutionary 2-year program transforms complete beginners into confident digital creators using visual block programming. Perfect for kids (7+), teens, and even adults who want to start coding without typing complex syntax.

Students will master block-based coding through platforms like Scratch, Code.org, and MakeCode, create games and animations, explore AI tools, design graphics with Canva, edit videos, master Microsoft Office, build mobile apps, and eventually transition to text-based programming. By completion, learners will have created 50+ projects and gained essential 21st-century digital skills.
what_makes_this_different: 100% visual learning - no typing required to start
Age-appropriate content with separate tracks for kids, teens, and adults
Covers ALL major block coding platforms
Includes AI tools, design, and productivity software
Real-world digital skills beyond just coding

learning_path.phase_1: Foundation (Months 1-6): Block Coding Basics, Scratch, Game Logic, Creative Projects
learning_path.phase_2: Advanced Blocks (Months 7-12): Complex Games, AI Tools, App Development, Robotics
learning_path.phase_3: Creative Suite (Months 13-18): Design, Video Editing, Microsoft Skills, Advanced Projects
learning_path.phase_4: Professional Path (Months 19-24): Text Coding Transition, Web Development, Portfolio Building

phase_1_foundation.title: PHASE 1: Foundation & Block Coding Basics (Months 1-6, Weeks 1-26)
phase_1_foundation.description: Start your coding journey with fun, visual programming. Learn computational thinking, create games, animations, and interactive stories using block-based platforms.

month_1_2.title: Months 1-2: Introduction to Coding & Scratch Basics

week_1_2.title: Welcome to the Digital World
topics: What is coding? Why is it important?
Introduction to algorithms with real-life examples
Your first animation: Making a cat walk
week_1_2.practice: Daily: 15 min block exploration, 30 min creative time

week_3_4.title: Motion and Animation in Scratch
topics: Moving sprites: go to, glide, move steps
projects: Virtual pet that moves and makes sounds

week_5_6.title: Events and Interactivity
topics: Event blocks: when flag clicked, when key pressed

week_7_8.title: Introduction to Game Logic
topics: Game states: start, playing, game over

week_11_12.title: Variables and Data
week_11_12.practice: Build 10 projects using variables and lists

week_13_14.title: Code.org and Hour of Code
projects: Build app prototype in App Lab

week_17.title: Month 3-4 Review & Showcase
projects: CAPSTONE: Original game with all learned features
Game includes: menu, levels, scoring, saves

week_26.title: Phase 1 Final Project
projects: Create same game in Scratch, MakeCode, and Blockly
Include: story mode, endless mode, multiplayer option

phase_2_frontend_mastery.title: PHASE 2: Advanced Blocks & Creative Computing (Months 7-12, Weeks 27-52)
phase_2_frontend_mastery.description: Explore advanced platforms, AI tools, mobile app development, and creative computing with more sophisticated block-based environments.

month_7_8.title: Months 7-8: MIT App Inventor & Mobile Apps

week_29_30.title: Advanced App Features
week_29_30.practice: Add advanced features to previous apps

week_52.title: Phase 2 Integration Project
projects: MAJOR CAPSTONE: Educational Game with Documentation
Include: Design docs, presentations, videos, marketing materials

phase_3_backend_engineering.title: PHASE 3: Advanced Platforms & Professional Skills (Months 13-18, Weeks 53-78)
phase_3_backend_engineering.description: Master advanced creative tools, 3D design, advanced AI, professional software, and begin transition to text-based coding.

week_78.title: Phase 3 Showcase Project
projects: Options: Educational platform, Game studio, Digital magazine, App suite
Include: Full documentation, marketing materials, presentation

phase_4_advanced_production.title: PHASE 4: Text Coding Transition & Professional Development (Months 19-24, Weeks 79-104)
phase_4_advanced_production.description: Transition from blocks to text-based programming, web development basics, and professional portfolio creation.

week_101_102.title: Final Capstone Project - Development
projects: Options: Educational platform, Social impact app, Game studio project, Business solution, Creative technology showcase
Requirements: Multiple technologies, full documentation, presentation ready, deployable, scalable

week_104.title: Graduation & Future Planning
week_104.assessment: FINAL COMPREHENSIVE ASSESSMENT - Complete evaluation of all skills

projects_throughout_course: Phase 1: 25+ games in Scratch, MakeCode projects, Micro:bit inventions, Blockly challenges
Phase 2: 20+ mobile apps, AI projects, Canva designs, Microsoft Office suite, video projects
Phase 3: VR/AR experiences, 3D models, Roblox games, advanced AI, IoT projects, robotics
Phase 4: Python programs, web applications, full stack projects, specialization projects
Final: Professional-grade capstone project using multiple technologies
additional_learning_resources.total_projects_built: 100+ projects from simple animations to complex applications
skills_mastered: Block Programming: Scratch, Code.org, MakeCode, Blockly, App Inventor
Game Development: Roblox Studio, Unity (visual scripting), Minecraft Education
AI & ML: Machine Learning for Kids, Teachable Machine, AI tools integration
Design: Canva, Adobe basics, 3D modeling with Tinkercad, UI/UX basics
Microsoft Suite: Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Teams, OneNote mastery
Video & Media: Video editing, audio production, content creation, streaming
Programming: Python, HTML/CSS/JavaScript basics, database fundamentals
Professional: Project management, collaboration, presentation, documentation
21st Century: Problem-solving, computational thinking, creativity, digital literacy

who_is_this_for.kids: Ages 7-12 wanting to learn coding through play
who_is_this_for.teens: Ages 13-17 building tech skills for future
who_is_this_for.adults: Beginners wanting visual introduction to coding
who_is_this_for.educators: Teachers wanting to learn coding education
who_is_this_for.parents: Parents wanting to learn alongside children
